Class CtrlPresentation

  • public class CtrlPresentation
extends javafx.application.Application
    Domain controller, manages the presentation layer

    Sergi Serrano Casalins, Nicolas Gouttefangeas Ballo, Marcos Riverola Errando, Samuel Hoenle

      • getListOfSelectedProblems

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String[]> getListOfSelectedProblems(java.util.List<java.lang.String> difficulties,
                                                                    java.util.List<java.lang.String> types,
                                                                    java.util.List<java.lang.String> names)
                                                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns a List of selected Problems in CtrlDomain.problemCollection in String arrays to be displayed. Problems can be selected after Difficulty, Type or the Player who created them
        Parameters:
        difficulties - A List of Strings representing Difficultys to filter after
        types - A List of Strings representing Types to filter after
        names - A List of Strings representing Player.names to filter after
        Returns:
        A List of an array of Strings, each containing all information of all selected Problems to be displayed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        See Also:
        CtrlDomain.getListOfSelectedProblems(List, List, List)

                                                      int columns,
                                                      java.lang.String[][] map)

        Generates a personalized problem and returns the displayable info

      • loadProblemFromPath

        public java.lang.String[] loadProblemFromPath(java.lang.String path)
                                       throws java.io.IOException,
                                              java.text.ParseException,
                                              CtrlDomain.ProblemExistsException,
                                              CtrlDomain.ProblemNotValidException
        Loads a problem from a text file. See CtrlDomain.loadProblemFromPath(String) for formatting requirements.
        Parameters:
        path - Path to the file to be loaded
        Returns:
        Whether or not the file has been successfully loaded and added to the problem collection
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - Thrown when the passed path does not link to a file.
        java.io.IOException - Can be thrown by CtrlDomain.loadProblemFromPath(String)
        java.text.ParseException - The file does not fulfil the format requirements.
        CtrlDomain.ProblemExistsException
        CtrlDomain.ProblemNotValidException
        See Also:
        CtrlDomain.loadProblemFromPath(String)

      • saveAttempt

        public void saveAttempt(java.lang.String id,
                        java.lang.String[][] solution,
                        int time)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Saves a started attempt to be played later
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the problem
        solution - the current solution of the problem
        time - spent solving the problem up to the point to be stored
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Could not write on Attempt file
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - Outdated Attempt file

      • getHint

        public java.lang.String[] getHint(java.lang.String[][] solution,
                                  java.lang.String adjacency,
                                  int columns,
                                  int rows,
                                  java.lang.String type,
                                  int lastNumber)
        Returns the position and the number of the next step of a started player Attempt, empty string if no solution found;
        Parameters:
        solution - the current player's solution to a problem
        adjacency - the adjacency attribute of the problem being solved
        columns - the number of columns of the solution
        rows - the number of rows of the solution
        type - the type attribute of the problem being solved
        lastNumber - the last number added to the solution by the player
        Returns:
        The x and y position of the following number of a solution if solvable, empty string otherwise

        Parameters:

      • getSolution

        public java.lang.String[][] getSolution(java.lang.String[][] solution,
                                        java.lang.String adjacency,
                                        int columns,
                                        int rows,
                                        java.lang.String type)
        Returns a matrix with the solution to the current attempt of the player
        Parameters:
        solution - the current started solution of a problem by a player
        adjacency - adjacency used in the problem
        columns - number of columns of the problem's map
        rows - number of rows of the problem's map
        type - the type of the problem
        Returns:
        the solution of the started attempt

      • loadProblemFromPath

        public java.lang.String[] loadProblemFromPath(java.lang.String path)
                                       throws java.io.IOException,
                                              java.text.ParseException,
                                              CtrlDomain.ProblemExistsException,
                                              CtrlDomain.ProblemNotValidException
        Loads a problem from a text file. See Problem.readProblemFromFile(String, String) for formatting requirements.
        Parameters:
        path - Path to the file to be loaded
        Returns:
        Whether or not the file has been successfully loaded and added to the problem collection
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - Thrown when the passed path does not link to a file.
        java.io.IOException - Can be thrown by Problem.readProblemFromFile(String, String)
        java.text.ParseException - The file does not fulfil the format requirements.
        CtrlDomain.ProblemExistsException
        CtrlDomain.ProblemNotValidException
        See Also:
        Problem.readProblemFromFile(String, String)

      • getHint

        public java.lang.String[] getHint(java.lang.String[][] solution,
                                  java.lang.String adjacency,
                                  int columns,
                                  int rows,
                                  java.lang.String type,
                                  int lastNumber)
        Returns the position and the number of the next step of a started player Attempt, empty string if no solution found;
        Parameters:
        solution - the current player's solution to a problem
        adjacency - the adjacency attribute of the problem being solved
        columns - the number of columns of the solution
        rows - the number of rows of the solution
        type - the type attribute of the problem being solved
        lastNumber - the last number added to the solution by the player
        Returns:
        The x and y position of the following number of a solution if solvable, empty string otherwise

        public java.lang.String[][] getSolution(java.lang.String[][] solution,

                                        int rows,
                                        java.lang.String type)
